TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit WizardStepCollection extends System.Object implements class System.Collections.ICollection, class System.Collections.IEnumerable, class System.Collections.IList

Docs.summary: Represents a collection of -derived objects in a control that acts as a wizard. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The WizardStepCollection class is used to store and manage a collection of <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepBase>-derived objects in a control that acts as a wizard, such as the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CreateUserWizard> control or the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard> control. For example, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard> control uses the WizardStepCollection class for its <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.WizardSteps%2A> property.
There are multiple ways you can access the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepBase>-derived objects in the WizardStepCollection:
- Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepCollection.Item%2A> property to directly access a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepBase>-derived object at a specific zero-based index.
- Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepCollection.GetEnumerator%2A> method to create an enumerator that can be used to iterate through the collection.
- Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepCollection.CopyTo%2A> method to copy the contents of the WizardStepCollection collection into an <xref:System.Array> object.
## Examples The following example demonstrates how to populate the WizardStepCollection collection using declarative syntax.
[!code-vb[System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepCollectionDeclare#3](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.web.ui.webcontr_56_1.aspx)] [!code-cs[System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepCollectionDeclare#3](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.web.ui.webcontr_56_1.aspx)]
The following example demonstrates how to programmatically populate a WizardStepCollection collection.
[!code-vb[System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepCollection#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.web.ui.webcontr_56_2.aspx)] [!code-cs[System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepCollection#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.web.ui.webcontr_56_2.aspx)]
The following is the code-behind file for the Web page in the preceding example.
[!code-cs[System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepCollection#2](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.web.ui.webcontr_56_3.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepCollection#2](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.web.ui.webcontr_56_3.vb)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void Add(class System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepBase wizardStep) cil managed

Docs.param: The -derived object to append to the collection.
Docs.summary: Appends the specified -derived object to the end of the collection.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The Add method adds the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepBase>-derived object to the end of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepCollection> collection. To add a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepBase>-derived object to the collection at a specific index location, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepCollection.AddAt%2A> method.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates programmatically creating a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard> control and using the Add method to add <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepBase>-derived <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStep> objects to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.WizardSteps%2A> collection. Note that in the example, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.WizardSteps%2A> property of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard> control is an instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepCollection> class.
[!code-vb[System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardSteps#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/dbb341bd-e6ba-460d-b742-_1.aspx)] [!code-cs[System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardSteps#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/dbb341bd-e6ba-460d-b742-_1.aspx)]

MemberSignature.Value: public void AddAt (int index, System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepBase wizardStep);
.method public hidebysig instance void AddAt(int32 index, class System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepBase wizardStep) cil managed

Docs.param: The index location at which to insert -derived object.
The -derived object to append to the collection.
Docs.summary: Adds the specified -derived object to the collection at the specified index location.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The AddAt method adds the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepBase>-derived object to the collection at the specified index location.
To add a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepBase>-derived object to the end of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepCollection> collection, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepCollection.Add%2A> method.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Clear() cil managed

Docs.summary: Removes all -derived objects from the collection.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the Clear method to remove all the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepBase>-derived objects from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepCollection> collection.
> [!NOTE] > After the Clear method removes the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepBase>-derived objects from the collection, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepCollection.Count%2A> property of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepCollection> collection has a value of zero.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance bool Contains(class System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepBase wizardStep) cil managed

Docs.param: The -derived object to find in the collection.
Docs.summary: Determines whether the collection contains a specific -derived object.
Docs.returns: if the -derived object is found in the collection; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use the Contains method to determine whether a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepBase>-derived object is contained in the collection. This method is commonly used to test for the existence of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepBase>-derived object before performing a task, such as removing a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepBase>-derived object from the collection.

MemberSignature.Value: public void CopyTo (System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepBase[] array, int index);
.method public hidebysig instance void CopyTo(class System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepBase[] array, int32 index) cil managed

Docs.param: A zero-based array of objects that receives the items copied from the collection.
The position in the target array at which the array starts receiving the copied items.
Docs.summary: Copies all the items from a collection to a compatible one-dimensional array of objects, starting at the specified index in the target array.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the CopyTo method to copy the contents of the collection into the specified zero-based array. Items are copied starting at the specified index of the target array. After the items are in an array, you can use array syntax to access the items in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepCollection> collection.
As an alternative, you can also use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepCollection.GetEnumerator%2A> method to create an enumerator that can be used to access the items in the collection.
## Examples The following example demonstrates how to use the CopyTo method to copy the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepBase> objects from the collection to an array. The array is then iterated through to display the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.ID%2A> property of each <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepBase>-derived object. Note that in the example, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.WizardSteps%2A> property of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard> control is an instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepCollection> class.
[!code-cs[System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepCollectionCopyTo#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/069e4b03-58e3-4a5a-8594-_1.aspx)] [!code-vb[System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepCollectionCopyTo#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/069e4b03-58e3-4a5a-8594-_1.aspx)]

Docs.summary: Gets the number of -derived objects in the control's collection.
Docs.value: The number of -derived objects in the control.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use the Count property to determine the number of <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepBase>-derived objects in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepCollection> collection. The Count property is commonly used when iterating through the collection to determine its upper bound.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Collections.IEnumerator GetEnumerator() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns an -implemented object that can be used to iterate through the -derived objects in the collection.
Docs.returns: An -implemented object that contains all the -derived objects in the collection.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance int32 IndexOf(class System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepBase wizardStep) cil managed

Docs.param: The -derived object to search for in the collection.
Docs.summary: Determines the index value that represents the position of the specified -derived object in the collection.
Docs.returns: If found, the zero-based index of the first occurrence of the -derived object passed in within the current collection; otherwise, -1.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use the IndexOf method to determine the index of the specified <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepBase>-derived object in the current <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepCollection> collection. If the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepBase>-derived object is not in the collection, the method returns -1.

MemberSignature.Value: public void Insert (int index, System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepBase wizardStep);
.method public hidebysig instance void Insert(int32 index, class System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepBase wizardStep) cil managed

Docs.param: The index location at which to insert the -derived object.
The -derived object to insert into the collection.
Docs.summary: Inserts the specified -derived object into the collection at the specified index location.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The Insert method adds the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepBase>-derived object to the collection at the specified index location.
Alternatively, you can use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepCollection.AddAt%2A> method to add the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepBase>-derived object to the collection. To add a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepBase>-derived object to the end of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepCollection> collection, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepCollection.Add%2A> method.
> [!NOTE] > The Insert method and the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepCollection.AddAt%2A> method perform essentially the same function. When the Insert method is called, it simply passes the `wizardStep` and `index` parameters to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepCollection.AddAt%2A> method.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates programmatically creating a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard> control and using the Insert method to add <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepBase>-derived objects to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.WizardSteps%2A> collection. Note that in the example, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.WizardSteps%2A> property of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard> control is an instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepCollection> class.
[!code-vb[System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepCollectionInsert#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/a6945f59-a965-41a5-8e08-_1.aspx)] [!code-cs[System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepCollectionInsert#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/a6945f59-a965-41a5-8e08-_1.aspx)]

Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the -derived objects in the collection can be modified.
Docs.value: if the collection can be modified; otherwise, .

Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether access to the collection is synchronized (thread-safe).

remarks.format:
## Remarks This property is derived from the <xref:System.Collections.ICollection> interface and is overridden to always return `false`.
For more information on the IsSynchronized property, see the <xref:System.Collections.ICollection.IsSynchronized%2A> property of the <xref:System.Collections.ICollection> interface

Docs.param: The index of the object to retrieve.
Docs.summary: Gets a -derived object from the collection at the specified index.
Docs.value: The -derived object in the collection at the specified index location.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use the Item property to retrieve the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepBase>-derived object at the specified index location in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepCollection> collection using array notation.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void Remove(class System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepBase wizardStep) cil managed

Docs.param: The -derived object to remove from the collection.
Docs.summary: Removes the specified -derived object from the collection.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the Remove method to remove the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepBase>-derived object from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepCollection> collection. Alternatively, you can use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepCollection.RemoveAt%2A> method to remove a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepBase>-derived object from a specified location in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepCollection> collection.
## Examples The following example demonstrates how to use the Remove method to remove a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepBase>-derived object from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepCollection> collection. Note that in the example, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.WizardSteps%2A> property of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard> control is an instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepCollection> class.
[!code-vb[System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepCollectionRemove#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/f9ffdaaf-8580-49a0-8194-_1.aspx)] [!code-cs[System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepCollectionRemove#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/f9ffdaaf-8580-49a0-8194-_1.aspx)]

Docs.summary: Removes the -derived object from the collection at the specified location.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use the RemoveAt method to remove the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepBase>-derived object from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepCollection> collection at the specified index location. Alternatively, you can remove a specific <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepBase>-derived object from the collection using the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepCollection.Remove%2A> method.

Docs.summary: Gets an object that can be used to synchronize access to the collection.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The object returned in this implementation is the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepCollection> object itself.
For more information on the SyncRoot property, see the <xref:System.Collections.ICollection.SyncRoot%2A> property of the <xref:System.Collections.ICollection> interface.
